prompt: <description>**Overall Shape Information** The final shape to be constructed is a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and its sides are parallel to each other. The cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. **Part 1 Instructions** Construct the rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. **Part 1 - Coordinate System Setup** Set up the coordinate system with the Euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, -90.0 degrees] and the translation vector as [0.0, 0.3012, 0.0]. **Part 1 - 2D Sketch** On the XY plane of the coordinate system, generate the 2D sketch with one face (face\\_1) containing two loops (loop\\_1 and loop\\_2). - **Loop 1** Draw four curves for loop\\_1, with the following properties: - line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.3041, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.3041, 0.0], End Point [0.3041, 0.598] - arc\\_1: Start Point [0.3041, 0.598], Mid Point [0.152, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.598] - line\\_3: Start Point [0.0, 0.598], End Point [0.0, 0.0] - **Loop 2** Draw one circle for loop\\_2, with the following properties: - circle\\_1: Center [0.152, 0.598], Radius 0.0904 Ensure all lines in each loop are connected to form a closed loop. **Part 1 - 3D Extrusion** Extrude the 2D sketch into a 3D model with the following property values: - extrude\\_depth\\_towards\\_normal: 0.3012 - extrude\\_depth\\_opposite\\_normal: 0.0 - sketch\\_scale: 0.75 - operation: Create a new solid body After completing these steps, you will have successfully constructed Part 1, a three-dimensional, rectangular prism with a cylindrical hole in the center. The prism has a flat top and bottom, and its sides are parallel to each other. The cylindrical hole is centered along the length of the prism. The dimensions of Part 1 are 0.75 x 0.3012 x 0.75 (length x width x height).</description>
